comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Belongs with this photo, posted earlier: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4888058445/ [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4888058445/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The scandalous artwork is Henry Moore's "Reclining Figure, 1939," which was fabricated from elmwood. Moore sold it in 1941, for 300 pounds. A photo shows Moore with the yet-unfinished work: www.henry-moore.org/pg/henry-moore-research/henry-moores-...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This photo from the MOMA shoot actually appeared in Downbeat. See hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/wgpubs.052 for a scan of the article Got (Bill Gottlieb) wrote about the visit!
